ygData.subject: Re: Building HyperNEAT on OS X
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey Jeff, I haven t tried to build the library with OS/X yet. It looks like you are having trouble getting the boost libraries linked in. The problem is that

Hey Jeff,

I haven't tried to build the library with OS/X yet.

It looks li=
ke you are having trouble getting the boost libraries
linked in.

The probl=
em is that the boost library has this complex naming
convention for its lib=
raries and it is hard to write a script that can
handle every possible case=
.  I believe that the creators of cmake are
working on a script which is co=
mprehensive enough to work on all systems.

In the meantime, here is what y=
ou can do:

1) Get the boost library (either by building yourself or using =
a binary)

2) Find out what library name the boost threading examples use.
=

3) edit the CMakelists.txt inside the Hypercube_NEAT directory and in
the =
TARGET_LINK_LIBRARIES(...) section, replace the boost thread
library name w=
ith the appropriate name.




--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Jeff Clune <jclu=
ne@...> wrote:
>
> Hello all-
> 
> Has anyone been able to build HyperNEAT =
on OS X Tiger (10.4.1,
> specifically)? I am referring to the HyperNEAT ver=
sion on the eplex
page.
> 
> After a fair amount of tinkering with it, I go=
t it to compile but now am
> having troubles in the linking stage.
> 
> If =
someone has been able to do it, can you email me at jclune@...? I'd
> love =
to hear how you did it, but don't want to clog up everyone's
inboxes.
> 
> =
In case you are interested, the current error is
> 
> Linking CXX executabl=
e ../out/Hypercube_NEAT
> /usr/bin/ld: can't locate file for: -lboost_threa=
d-gcc-mt-1_33_1
> collect2: ld returned 1 exit status
> make[2]: *** [out/H=
ypercube_NEAT] Error 1
> make[1]: *** [Hypercube_NEAT/CMakeFiles/Hypercube_=
NEAT.dir/all] Error 2
> make: *** [all] Error 2
> 
> I am pretty sure what =
it is looking for is
> libboost_thread-gcc-mt-1_33_1.dylib
> 
> But I don't=
 have that file.
> 
> In the my_hyperneat_dir/out directory I do have
> 
> =
Results/           
> libboost_thread-gcc-mt-1_33_1.so.1.33.1*
> data/     =
                                   libtinyxmldll.so*
> dependencyAdder.cpp*=
                         libwx_base-2.8.so.0*
> libNEAT.dylib*             =
                  libwx_gtk2_adv-2.8.so.0*
> libNEAT.so*                   =
               libwx_gtk2_core-2.8.so.0*
> libboost_filesystem-gcc-mt-1_33_=
1.so.1.33.1*
> 
> I have tried a few things to try to trick it into grabbin=
g
> libboost_thread-gcc-mt-1_33_1.so.1.33.1 but no dice.
> 
> FYI: Since I =
don't know what the BOOST_STAGE directory should be in the
> cmake file, I =
just made it point to my_hyperneat_dir/out to see if
it would
> grab these =
libraries.
> 
> 
> If you have any ideas, please let me know at jclune@...
